website_summaries.verdict: Sturdily constructed of solid steel and nylon mesh and rope, this wrist roller can also be used to build hand and forearm strength.
pros: Features tear-resistant, soft, padded foam handles for better grip and to lessen hand fatigue, as well as strong nylon webbing strap for safety
Works with most standard weight plates
Use of product helps athletic performance in other sports, like tennis, golf, baseball, wrestling, etc
60-Day money back guarantee if not satisfied, plus 1-year manufacturer's warranty
cons: Bolt that keeps weight plates secured to strap appear to come loose occasionally
Use with caution to avoid weights dropping onto feet or toes

customer_reviews.title: In the beginning it worked great. I used a carabineer to attach it to ...
customer_reviews.text: In the beginning it worked great. I used a carabineer to attach it to my Bowflex. Unfortunately after only 3 uses the foam started spinning on the handles. This makes it impossible to use. There are MANY reviews sharing this same issue so I know it's not just my unit. Spend your money elsewhere. UPDATE I decided to try to get mine working so I wouldn't have to go through returning and buying something else. I pulled the foam off, sanded the powder coat and used plasti-dip to coat each handle. This works great.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. O. Neal

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Cheap piece of junk the 3 spot welds that attach the pipe are microscopic, broke after minimal usage of light weights. Buy anything else
customer_reviews.author: Gator

customer_reviews.title: After the second use, the padding on the bar/handles ...
customer_reviews.text: After the second use, the padding on the bar/handles comes off which ruins the product due to the need to have grip on the bar. It's the equivalent of your tires rotating but not having any traction.
customer_reviews.author: James Litman

customer_reviews.title: I broke one just like it with 15 lbs
customer_reviews.text: I broke one just like it with 15 lbs, The plastic , or pig iron whaevter the clip is , broke. I would not want to put my toes under the touted 100 lbs this product claims to be able to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Scwartzman

customer_reviews.title: Not enough grip.
customer_reviews.text: The handle material is very poor. I use it with about 23 lbs of weight and it’s nearly impossible to use to to it slipping in your hands. Next I tried using gloves, which solved the grip issue, but now the handle itself would begin to slip off since even the inside of the handle didn’t provide enough friction to the plastic. I wish my old one didn’t break. Needless to say I plan on returning this ASAP
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was missing the washer that keeps the weight plates on. Unacceptable. Would have been great as it is solid metal construction with nice foam grips. Too bad parts were missing. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality control must have been on break.
customer_reviews.text: Another winner from China...they manufactured the washer with an inner diameter too small to slide down the shaft. Apparently no one bothered to check if it fit and just tossed it in the bag. I just went to the hardware store and found a suitable replacement part because it isn't worth the time going through the return process to possibly end up with another defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Flack

customer_reviews.title: It is a great value and works well for its function
customer_reviews.text: I grew up playing baseball and used to use a mop handle, string and a weight to accomplish what this does. This is a lot easier. I can see how the foam grips may come loose, so I plan to use athletic tape or batting tape to replace it when the time comes. It is a great value and works well for its function.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Wood

customer_reviews.title: Won't work fine with 2" plates
customer_reviews.text: The title says this works with 2" weight plates. But with 2" Olympic plates it slides on one side and not comfortable using. I have other plates with 1.15" yes4all with those it works fine for now. But as said in other reviews it won't work with 100lb I hope, can be used with 20-30pounds.
customer_reviews.author: lakshmanan

customer_reviews.title: Multi purpose, works great
customer_reviews.text: Got 2 of these morso for the plate holder. Made a cable system with pulleys, ropes, and different handles. As a forearm blaster, its great too. I cut the rope down on the second one and use it as a 2 handed tricep/bicep handle for my cables. Works great as intended, and butchered for my own purposes
customer_reviews.author: Alf

customer_reviews.title: A one-star rating is too high. Foam grips covering ...
customer_reviews.text: A one-star rating is too high. Foam grips covering the bar are not attached in any way, so freely slip on the bar. Not what you want in this product.
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: Thanks !
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product wrist roller . it would have been perfect if they would have used a cable instead of a rope that I don't really think will last for years to come . But all and all I really do think it is pretty good for the money if you want bigger forearms .
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Enough Roller Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Product is effective in targeting forearms. The loadable anchor is sturdy enough. I have been using 1-inch diameter plates, which I would recommend if possible, so that there is not a lot of listing if the weight shifts. My only negative criticism is that one of the handles is not in a fixed position and will rotate slightly as you perform your rolling motion. The give is not enough to make me regret purchasing and can be solved with liquid glue.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Herrington

customer_reviews.title: Product does not come with plate loader.
customer_reviews.text: The wrist roller DOES NOT come with the bottom plate loader as shown in your advertisement picture. It should be shown without the plate loader. " little false advertising" other then not getting what you expected". It's a descent product.
customer_reviews.author: Tom yonek

customer_reviews.title: A fabulous and very inexpensive exercise device
customer_reviews.text: I got amazing results from this device in no time. The only problem is that you need some weight plates. They are not included. Some one should offer to sell you the plates. It is not convenient to switch plates from other uses.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES C.CARLIN

customer_reviews.title: Pure Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Foam handles started to slip during first use - makes product dangerous. Going to resort to the method we used in the old days: sawed off wooden bat handle, drill a hole and tie a rope from the handle to a weight...
customer_reviews.author: RAM

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The rubber on the grip is not glued to handles and you cannot pull any weight, because it scrolls. I damaged my laminate because it slipped and hit the floor
customer_reviews.author: Gene Arrow

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I compare this against the ones sold in Walmart or other convenience stores. This beauty is sturdy from handles, strap and holder. Thicker handles will engage your forearms more than used, they will burn. It definitively makes your forearm workout more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: R Pizana

customer_reviews.title: Unless your already a die-hard strength athlete or work-out regularly. I suggest baby steps.
customer_reviews.text: Wanna blast your forearms to greater heights of strength? Add this equipment to your arsenal. You will be satisfied. I gave it one star for comfort! Cause with this piece turning your forearms into corded steel, there is no comfort!!! No pain. No GAIN!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Wow , Really?
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a waste , I really thought this would be a amazing workout but it turns out to be a waste of time and money. The handle grip keeps moving along and it doesn't help at all . I've attached an image
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad T.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: The grips are somewhat textured so your hands don't slip. The cord is high quality and the overall construction appears to be pretty durable. Hope to have this for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap construction. The foam handles rolled from the first use, and the rope stretched quite a bit. Would suggest a wooden dowel/PVC pipe with a nylon rope for next to nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Well made and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: A wrist roller adds alternative and practical exercises for the hands and forearms. I'm happy with the quality of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dan de Plaines

customer_reviews.title: Solid steel construction, very durable, will last forever!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon is always out of this item and I can see why. It is a very solid and durable piece of workout equipment and the price point is also very good. And it can definitely hold more weight than I can lift with my wrists. The only downside would be that the strap is a bit too long but if you are taller than 5' 9" than it would probably be just right for you. This was not enough of a reason to take it down to four stars since I am looking at the overall quality of the item.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Wendel

customer_reviews.title: Great Strengthening Tool
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I used to do this when I was younger. I attached a weight to a short barbell using a string. This helps strengthen your forearms and hands. Will make you stronger. Great for athletes! Any sport, doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Babb

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The weights stay centered when rolling this one up and a bar can be placed through the center of the roller if you are not strong enough to hold everything. great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Mehrunesbalrog

customer_reviews.title: simple
customer_reviews.text: simple and effective design. Made from what appears to be quality materials. good addition to a home gym
customer_reviews.author: Benjistuie

customer_reviews.title: You have to glue
customer_reviews.text: You have to glue the hand grips to the bar, or they slide around. I used two part epoxy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good. The hand grips, which are a spongy foam material are glued to the handle. The glue seperated on the first use and then "sleeves" will turn unless gripped very hard. I have bought some glue to attempt to reattach and if that works it will be great. There is aother fix if that fails and I would use handlebar tape from a bicycle shop to make a non slip hand hold. But I think the glue will work. Worth the cash.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rizor

customer_reviews.title: you can only use this for light weights
customer_reviews.text: this wrist roller is unusable for anyone intending to load more than 10lbs. I put 25lbs on and instantly the handles slipped off. The metal handle inside is too slippery to use and now this thing is basically useless. I do appreciate, however, that they used metal. It is sturdy and won't snap in half like the wooden wrist rollers.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Dong

customer_reviews.title: A great buy
customer_reviews.text: I could have bought a weight, rope, and stick, but I like this rope and stick for the price I got it. This is awesome for anyone who wants to work on their forearm strength, and can be manipulated with different arm positions to maximize this capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Lycantis

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Easy to lose the essential nut for the weight holder. Despite this it works well.

customer_reviews.title: Works just great. Wife and I have used it and its ...
customer_reviews.text: Works just great. Wife and I have used it and its full of pain for the whole family. Enjoy. Great exercise for the arms but boy does it make you sore.

customer_reviews.title: The plastic grip disconnected from the handle
customer_reviews.text: The plastic grip was I am pretty sure just glued on and I use decent weight maybe like 25 - 30 and only used a handful of times the grip disconnected nad was free-floatingaround and no longer grips to the tool and I could not use it anymore and resorted to trying to manually glue it back on but nothing had worked so far.
customer_reviews.author: Nolen Sellwood

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for wrist rehab after surgery. Got a very food work out with it. Easy to assemble and use.l

customer_reviews.title: This product really works
customer_reviews.text: This product really works. I like the padded grips and the way it is configured.

customer_reviews.title: Yes4All Wrist and Forearm Blaster
customer_reviews.text: Love using this when exercising. Easy to swap out weights.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth your money
customer_reviews.text: This thing is hell a sturdy , I love it
customer_reviews.author: Alex Dodds

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: The grip on here is great an you can tell it won’t break down over time while using this. Everything is made well. I only put 10lbs on the bottom but going to try heavier weight very soon. It looks like it will be able to handle the weight
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and I knew that it would be a great purchase. It has been great for me to ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this when I went through rehab, with my wrist, and I knew that it would be a great purchase. It has been great for me to use with my athletes, as it ensures that they will no longer have weak forearms/hands. I recommend it for any athlete, or anyone wanting to have stronger forearms and hands!!
customer_reviews.author: RFletch50

customer_reviews.title: Didn't come with metal piece for weight.
customer_reviews.text: Item didn't come with metal piece to attach a weight to. So I just use the cord and clip it around a medicine ball.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B

customer_reviews.title: The rope near the handle is already starting to fray.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the price. The most weight I'd added to it is 15.5 lbs and tried to use it as a tricep pull down - didn't work so well. I only use it for wrist rolling and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Miller

customer_reviews.title: Completely useless!
customer_reviews.text: There is no lower plate to hold the weights. All they provided was a handle with a rope and hook. No way to secure the weights. Completely useless!
customer_reviews.author: Rick W

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke
customer_reviews.text: The design looks appealing but the welding is to thin and breaks after little usage with light weight

customer_reviews.title: Missing part
customer_reviews.text: The box was tore up and missing piece to hold the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Have not used with more than 15 lbs, but can take some abuse from a kid.

customer_reviews.title: Forearm burns
customer_reviews.text: This will get your arms burning if you use it right. My only con is that I wish the shoulders on the center were a bit taller. I often find the rope finding it's way onto the hand grip instead of wrapping nicely.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It is just the handle and rope with a clip ...
customer_reviews.text: It is just the handle and rope with a clip. Was hoping for the center piece that goes through and holds the weight. I just wrapped the rope around the weight itself and it still woks.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Really Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what you need it to do. Made of steel, pretty heavy already, works out your wrists great!

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Works great and fast shipment. It was initially missing a piece, but they replaced it right away.
customer_reviews.author: BO$$

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase. After 3 ish weeks of use ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase. After 3 ish weeks of use twice a week, the eye piece that holds the bar the weight sits on unscrewed, dropping the weight and driving the nut into the top of my foot. I picked up the item and it all fell apart again, this time at the bottom nut. I will continue to use, but with a wider stance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ehh I’d pass on this if could re do
customer_reviews.text: The design is lacking big time the rope is off center and does not stay in its tracking.

customer_reviews.title: ... the handles was loose and made using the product pretty difficult. Eventually had to just wrap that side ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the handles was loose and made using the product pretty difficult. Eventually had to just wrap that side of the bar with grip tape. Not the biggest irritation but I wish I didn't have to mod something out of the box. Also, the rope is a bit elastic, which also makes pulling up a weight kind of annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Fenlain

customer_reviews.title: I got blistas on my fingaz! buy some gloves.
customer_reviews.text: buy some gloves. got a blister first time I used it. start with a 10lb weight at least. I use it everyday. at 15lb now.

customer_reviews.title: Hans and Frans approved!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable grips, but i suggest gloves if you have girly hands like me.

customer_reviews.title: Works great

customer_reviews.title: Forearm growth!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best forearm workout out there. I integrate this into my routines every other day.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, except for the bolt at the bottom ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, except for the bolt at the bottom of the rope that holds the weight in place occasionally comes a bit loose. You have to be careful when lifting or it might fall off and drop the weight.

customer_reviews.title: Works good!

customer_reviews.text: Weight plate not included but shown in all pictures. Doesn't specifically say the weight plate is not included anywhere. Package arrived half opened and missing the washer.

customer_reviews.title: odd feeling for lack of better words. Only reason it's not 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Mine has yet to break as others have stated and I've been using it a few times a week for a few months now. The grip is a bit.... odd feeling for lack of better words. Only reason it's not 5 stars.

customer_reviews.title: The construction of this device is stellar👍

customer_reviews.title: Can’t handle the weight
customer_reviews.text: It’s somewhat sturdy but the main issue is anything over 10 pounds and the handles start spinning. I might glue the handles so they don’t move. Not the best design

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable tool for building forearm/grip strength
customer_reviews.text: It's an excellent product. Only small thing is the clip is kinda small so sometimes it comes undone when you lift it to work out. I bigger more secure clip would fix this small issue.

customer_reviews.title: Forearm Blaster...isolation for the forearms!
customer_reviews.text: And I thought I was getting a great forearm workout just doing hammer curls! Quality was good, but I did take the threaded bits apart and put a shot of loctite on them to keep things together. Add a 10lb weight, and pump up those forearms!

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe

product_meta.title: Yes4All Wrist and Forearm Blaster - Wrist Roller & Forearm Roller for Training, Workout - Wrist/Arm Blaster - Fit 1-inch Standard & 2-inch Olympic Weight Plates
product_meta.description:
HEAVY DUTY CONSTRUCTION FOR BETTER PERFORMANCE

Yes4All Wrist and Forearm Blaster is made from solid steel construction plus durable nylon webbing rope, featuring PVC handles for hand fatigue minimization and non-slip & comfy grip. Designed to work great with most standard-sized weight plates. 

IDEAL TOOL FOR ALL SPORT TRAINING

Yes4All Wrist and Forearm Blaster is perfect for sports like golf, baseball, tennis, wrestling, football, and climbing where wrist and forearm strength is one of the most important factors. It helps to create power and superior strength in your wrist and forearms. 

The Wrist and Forearm Blaster is simple to use and utilizes a time-proven method for developing ultimate grip strength. Also, it is great for hand and wrist rehabilitation patients to practice at home. 

HOW TO USE

Just roll the weight up and down, do as many reps as you can to effectively improve the strength in your hands, wrists and forearms. Add more weights as you get stronger. 

KEY FEATURES


 * Solid steel construction with padded foam grip 
 * Build strength in wrists and forearms
 * Work with standard-size weight plates (not included) 
 * Dimensions: 15.79 x 1.1 inches (LxW) 
 * Handle length: 6.27 inches
 * Adjustable durable webbing strap
 * Product weight: 1.5 lbs
 * Weight capacity: 100 lbs


WARRANTY: 1-year warranty and 30-day return (contact seller for more details)
feature_bullets: HEAVY GAUGE STEEL CONSTRUCTION: Constructed of heavy duty steel core that is highly durable and will retain peak performance even after long term heavy usage
PREMIUM PVC HANDLE: Features a tear-resistant, high density PVC handle to minimize your hand fatigue and provide a better, firm, secure grip while working out
ADJUSTABLE NYLON STRAP: Comes with a high quality nylon webbing strap to provide more comfort and extra safety during training, making sure that your fitness progress stays uninterrupted
FITS ALL STANDARD WEIGHT PLATES: The weight loading pin is designed to be compatible with all standard 1-inch weight plates and can support up to 100lbs, great for fitness lovers of all levels
GREAT FOR HANDS AND FOREARMS: Helps strengthening the wrists, hands and forearms as well as increasing muscle tone, ideal for athletes who are looking to improve their performances
